references.title: Publication bias is bad for science if not necessarily scientists
references.summary: Metascience analysis reinforcing why weak-effect literatures require strong anti-bias infrastructure.

references.title: Why psychologists must change the way they analyze their data: the case of psi
references.summary: Statistical critique highlighting exploratory flexibility and arguing that one-sided p-values overstated evidential strength.

references.title: Examining psychokinesis: the interaction of human intention with random number generators--a meta-analysis
references.summary: Classic RNG-PK synthesis often interpreted as evidence of weak effects but strong vulnerability to publication and selection bias.

references.title: A Bayes factor meta-analysis of Bem's ESP claim
references.summary: Meta-analytic Bayes factor approach showing how prior choices and aggregation strategy materially alter inference strength.

hypotheses.name: Bell nonlocality does not imply controllable signaling

references.title: Loophole-free Bell inequality violation using electron spins separated by 1.3 kilometres
references.summary: Confirms nonlocal quantum correlations while not establishing controllable faster-than-light communication channels.

references.title: Quantum field theory cannot provide faster-than-light communication
references.summary: Theoretical no-signaling constraint often cited to distinguish correlation nonlocality from actionable communication.

references.title: Paranormal beliefs and core knowledge confusions: A meta-analysis
references.summary: Supports cognitive-style pathways that can explain paranormal conviction without requiring real anomalous information transfer.

references.title: Superstition predicts perception of illusory control
references.summary: Shows a measurable cognitive mechanism linking superstition with over-attribution of control in random environments.

references.title: Raising the value of research studies in psychological science by increasing the credibility of research reports: the transparent Psi project
references.summary: Demonstrates an intensive transparency protocol and reports null replication for the flagship Bem task.

references.title: Correcting the past: failures to replicate ψ
references.summary: High-powered replication program that failed to reproduce key retroactive facilitation findings from Bem (2011).

references.title: AWAreness during REsuscitation - II: A multi-center study of consciousness and awareness in cardiac arrest
references.summary: High-control prospective design in extreme-consciousness context with very limited objective target-identification support.

hypotheses.name: False memory and magical ideation pathway

references.title: Paranormal beliefs and core knowledge confusions: A meta-analysis
references.summary: Supports cognitive-style pathways that can explain paranormal conviction without requiring real anomalous information transfer.

hypotheses.name: Protocol quality and transparency as effect moderators

references.title: Raising the value of research studies in psychological science by increasing the credibility of research reports: the transparent Psi project
references.summary: Demonstrates an intensive transparency protocol and reports null replication for the flagship Bem task.

references.title: Stage 2 Registered Report: Anomalous perception in a Ganzfeld condition - A meta-analysis of more than 40 years investigation
references.summary: Large registered-report synthesis finding a small but nonzero overall effect in Ganzfeld databases and stronger effects in selected participants.

references.title: Stage 1 Registered Report: Anomalous perception in a Ganzfeld condition - A meta-analysis of more than 40 years investigation
references.summary: Protocol-first phase that improves auditability of inclusion criteria and analyses before final synthesis.

references.title: Magical thinking in formal operational adults
references.summary: Lesser, R. & Paisner, M. (1985). Magical thinking in formal operational adults.Human Development, 28, 57-70.

references.title: Wings of Illusion
references.summary: Schumaker, J.F. (1990). Wings of Illusion. Cambridge: Polity Press.

references.title: Illusion of control for self and others in depressed and non-depressed college students
references.summary: Martin, D.J. ; Abramson, L.Y. & Alloy, L.B. (1984). Illusion of control for self and others in depressed and non-depressed college students.Journal of Personality and Social Psy...

hypotheses.name: Ganzfeld: small positive signal in registered-report synthesis

references.title: Stage 2 Registered Report: Anomalous perception in a Ganzfeld condition - A meta-analysis of more than 40 years investigation
references.summary: Large registered-report synthesis finding a small but nonzero overall effect in Ganzfeld databases and stronger effects in selected participants.

references.title: Meta-analysis that conceals more than it reveals: comment on Storm et al. (2010)
references.summary: Methodological critique emphasizing that meta-analytic significance alone is insufficient without robust independent replication.

references.title: Meta-analysis of free-response studies, 1992-2008: assessing the noise reduction model in parapsychology
references.summary: Influential synthesis suggesting positive free-response effects but later challenged on randomization and robustness grounds.

references.title: We should have seen this coming
references.summary: Argues that extraordinary temporal claims require stronger controls and direct tests of conventional artifact explanations.

hypotheses.name: Retrocausal claims challenged by modern replications

references.title: Correcting the past: failures to replicate ψ
references.summary: High-powered replication program that failed to reproduce key retroactive facilitation findings from Bem (2011).

references.title: Why psychologists must change the way they analyze their data: the case of psi
references.summary: Statistical critique highlighting exploratory flexibility and arguing that one-sided p-values overstated evidential strength.

references.title: A Bayes factor meta-analysis of Bem's ESP claim
references.summary: Meta-analytic Bayes factor approach showing how prior choices and aggregation strategy materially alter inference strength.

references.title: Feeling the future: experimental evidence for anomalous retroactive influences on cognition and affect
references.summary: Landmark controversial paper reporting retroactive facilitation effects and motivating large-scale replication efforts.
